In 2021 Q2, the total wafer sales volume reached 2.44 million 8-inch equivalents, marking a 3% increase quarter-over-quarter. The wafer Average Selling Price (ASP) increased by close to 5% in Q2, driven by price adjustments on select applications in mature sites and an improved product mix, including higher shipments of 28-nanometer wafers.

The increase in wafer ASP was primarily due to strategic price adjustments in both 12-inch and 8-inch nodes and a favorable product mix. The 28-nanometer technology, with its higher ASP and EBITDA margin, played a significant role in enhancing gross margins, reflecting robust demand across customer segments, particularly in applications like 5G smartphones and electric vehicles.
